channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fence section collapsed - Hoblingwell playground, 14th June
item.description:
A section of the fence on the north-west side of the playground at Hoblingwell has collapsed. It also missing a number of half-round pales. Please could this be repaired?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping- trollies, table and chair, 14th June
item.description:
Previously reported flytipping has just been moved 10 metres, not removed. Please can you add 'no flytipping' signs and a camera. It's it a constant problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Estate Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public tree Low branches., 14th June
item.description:
O/S 141 Upper Elmers End Road. Recent winds and rain have caused this tree to become very close to head height, though were OK a week ago. Please add this to your list of trees to be pruned ASAP Thankyou.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Se29rj, 14th June
item.description:
Some dog owner not cleaning up after their dog poop's I dont know if this is same dog or multiple dogs 136 Felixstowe road backyard beside footpath

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 112, Felixstowe Road, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: Graffiti all over bin, bus stop, bt cabinet etc, 14th June
item.description:
Graffiti is now covering the 291 bus stop, adjacent bin and street cabinet. This is happening repeatedly and deliberately. Literally nothing is being done by either the council or local police to deal with this. I have cleaned the graffiti several times due to reports being ignored. I have removed chicken boxes and litter from the street this morning. Failure to act and use available powers is making things worse and adding to the general sense of chronic neglect
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Timbercroft Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Road, Ladywell, London

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Furniture abandoned in the park, 14th June
item.description:
Left a big piece of wooden furniture in the park, usually drug users are around that spot using drugs after purchasing it from the corner near by, but now they are leaving piece of furniture too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115 & 117, Brandon Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Pole 5 & pole 7 are covered with foliage required cut, 14th June
item.description:
Pole 5 & pole 7 are covered with foliage. Refer the job to the local council, need to cut the debris. They blocking the signals. Check the attached photos, please. Local council need to deal with this issue.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Giant Hogweed -Exteamly Dangerous, 14th June
item.description:
Hi, There are a number of very large Giant Hogweed on Bexley Playing Fields. There are about a dozen of the plants and I saw young Children playing near by.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Water Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees and weeds, 14th June
item.description:
The trees and weeds have over grown, this is a cul de sac and there is a lot of elderly residents that live here also there is a lady that uses a wheelchair

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Caradoc Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches overhanging boundary of property., 14th June
item.description:
The large street cherry tree outside 66 Haywood Road is leaning towards the property. The branches are over hanging the boundary of the property and almost touching the house. The cherries that are falling from the tree are leaving red stains on the paint work of the property. The tree needs to be pruned back to the boundary of the property and the overall height reduced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haywood Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox decomposing and causing massive flies issue, 14th June
item.description:
There is a dead fox in the hedge on the public footpath which is rotting making an awful smell that comes into my house. There are also lots of maggots and flies which are then coming into my house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harvill Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
